events.message: The customer reported their vehicle was involved in a collision with another car on the highway.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and accident details.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the case and assist the customer throughout the process.
Sent acknowledgment to the customer confirming receipt of their auto accident claim submission.
Requested police report, photos of the collision damage, and repair estimates from the customer.
Customer provided all requested documents including the police report and photographs of the damaged vehicle.
Opened investigation to verify the collision details and assess liability based on provided evidence.
Investigation concluded confirming customer’s claim validity with supporting evidence from police reports.
Proposed settlement amount to cover repair costs and vehicle downtime based on damage evaluation.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the claims process.
Approved the claim and authorized payment for the agreed settlement to be processed promptly.
Transferred the settlement payment to the customer's account to cover vehicle repairs and expenses.
Closed the claim after ensuring all payments were received and customer’s case was fully resolved.
Archived the closed claim files and records according to company policy for future reference if needed.
